attributes.comment:
I am very concerned about the proposed USCIS increase. My husband and I are
in the process of adopting a child from an orphanage overseas. We have been
waiting for the adoption to be final for nearly two years. Thus, our USCIS will soon
expire and we will have to re-file and repay the full amount a second time.
Adoption fees are expensive enough, it is unreasonable to have to pay a fee twice
when the bureacracy is already causing our original one to expire with delays.
We would adopt in the U.S., however, there are no orphanages here and we want
to make sure we are adopting a child with true needs who would not have the
opportunity of a good quality life otherwise. I understand that our country's
growing population is a concern. But we shouldn't penalize immigrating future
citizens with increased fees. We should focus on birth control here, and impose
fees onto natural citizens who bring more than five children into the world period!
Over-reproducing is something we should have control over; not people who are
already born and simply want to leave everything they've known behind and come
to our country to reunite with family, be adopted, or hope for a better life with more
education and less crime and poverty. People are already sacrificing a lot
financially to bring an orphaned child to the U.S. or an elderly parent or student
who will become a permanent productive contributing member of our society.
Let's find other avenues for revenue, that do not directly affect the lives of such
people who already have enough obstacles to immigrate.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Melanie
